body: this PR adds a tox_loop() function that will block on the network sockets and call tox_iterate automatically along with 2 callbacks to allow a client to manage a mutex to maintain thread safety --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131)

_[auto_tests/tox_loop_test.c, line 43 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131#-KRTxIP6o9OT9tZUW3oW:-KRTxIP7atyn4GwbRjcJ:b1wwidp) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/5563cc0e5e46d29f46834fae1155803ad83d0b5d/auto_tests/tox_loop_test.c#L43)):_

_Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131)_

<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

@cleverca22 could explain why this PR is needed and why we should accept it? I know there was an IRC conversation, but it's nice to have this explained for the record and I didn't follow the conversation that much.
I gave it just a quick glance. I will review this more thoughtfully later.

if tox_iterate_interval() returns 50ms, and you only ever run tox_iterate() every 50ms, then it cant process received packets any more often

this leads to things like 50ms ping to a toxcore node on the same LAN, and 200ms pings to a toxcore node that only gets under ~57ms outside of tox

letting toxcore block on a select() call over all network FD's allows it to instantly respond to any incoming packets

Also, this documentation should be on the event itself. The typedef usually just gets parameter docs. Since there are no params here, you could document the fact that this event receives no data and just its invocation is all the information you need. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131)_
updated

_[other/apidsl/tox.in.h, line 815 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131#-KRUBt8Kws6kKwUuDD1f:-KRUBt8Kws6kKwUuDD1g:b-7ct7wl) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/151618ec73c8fb650819c0f9ea417e21cd0e50ff/other/apidsl/tox.in.h#L815)):_

> ``` objc
> 
> /**
>  * Run $iterate() automaticaly, only returns after ${loop.stop}().
> ```

"automatically". But this comment doesn't really explain what the function does. Running a function automatically could also just mean that it invokes it, and then sleeps until loop.stop().

_[other/apidsl/tox.in.h, line 823 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131#-KRUC7qEDRI8AsBK9CIi:-KRUC7qEDRI8AsBK9CIj:b-rsftq9) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/151618ec73c8fb650819c0f9ea417e21cd0e50ff/other/apidsl/tox.in.h#L823)):_

> ``` objc

>    */

_[toxcore/tox.c, line 484 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131#-KRUDI0Ld88doT-r949t:-KRUDI0Ld88doT-r949u:b-ndl2ye) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/151618ec73c8fb650819c0f9ea417e21cd0e50ff/toxcore/tox.c#L484)):_

> ``` C
> 
> /**
>  * Return the total FD count.
> ```

This comment is next to useless. `tox_fd_count` quite clearly states that it returns the fd count. Either elaborate or remove the comment.

_[toxcore/tox.c, line 491 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131#-KRUCMli2eP-DFyBEmyu:-KRUCMli2eP-DFyBEmyv:b-thxr1c) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/151618ec73c8fb650819c0f9ea417e21cd0e50ff/toxcore/tox.c#L491)):_

> ``` C
>     return 1 + m->net_crypto->tcp_c->tcp_connections_length;
> }
> /**
> ```

Add newline before comment.

---

_[toxcore/tox.c, line 492 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131#-KRUDT7xR-f1Vy-Gu12d:-KRUDT7xR-f1Vy-Gu12e:b-8m61ab) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/151618ec73c8fb650819c0f9ea417e21cd0e50ff/toxcore/tox.c#L492)):_

> ``` C
> }
> /**
>  * Gathers a list of every network FD to wait on.
> ```

It gathers a list of every FD that we expect network activity on. Whether the client code waits on it or polls is not up to this function.

---

_[toxcore/tox.c, line 494 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131#-KRUDpApeWFz2fY8-oSX:-KRUDpApeWFz2fY8-oSY:b-71zho2) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/151618ec73c8fb650819c0f9ea417e21cd0e50ff/toxcore/tox.c#L494)):_

> ``` C
>  * Gathers a list of every network FD to wait on.
>  */
> uint32_t tox_fds(Tox *tox, uint32_t *sockets, uint32_t max_sockets)
> ```

I'd prefer you just require (and document the requirement) that sockets is an array of length `tox_fd_count`. This is how the rest of the public API works as well. See e.g. the top level comment in tox.h about "Threading implications", and function names ending in `_size`.

---

_[toxcore/tox.c, line 545 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131#-KRUEgxaypSjqqxr9EkJ:-KRUEgxbKfyqxylFEhzB:b-p3hl62) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/151618ec73c8fb650819c0f9ea417e21cd0e50ff/toxcore/tox.c#L545)):_

> ``` C
> 
>     if (m->loop_start_cb) {
>         m->loop_start_cb(tox, user_data);
> ```

Can we call this at the beginning of the loop, then immediately call tox_iterate (so tox_iterate will be called before select), and call the stop cb at the end of the loop?

---

_[toxcore/tox.c, line 564 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131#-KRUCrsCC07YfQRnut9z:-KRUCrsCC07YfQRnutA-:b-5ove47) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/151618ec73c8fb650819c0f9ea417e21cd0e50ff/toxcore/tox.c#L564)):_

> ``` C
>             FD_SET(fdlist[i], &readable);
> 
>             if (fdlist[i] > maxfd) maxfd = fdlist[i];
> ```

Braces.

---

_[toxcore/tox.c, line 568 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131#-KRUClTLm_lyAsZh5F4e:-KRUClTLm_lyAsZh5F4f:bwf8k97) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/151618ec73c8fb650819c0f9ea417e21cd0e50ff/toxcore/tox.c#L568)):_

> ``` C
> 
>         timeout.tv_sec = 0;
>         timeout.tv_usec = tox_iteration_interval(tox) * 1000 * 2; // TODO, use a longer timeout
> ```

Add either a bug number or github username in parentheses after TODO. See #133.

---

> tox_loop returns `uint32_t`. tox_loop_worker returns `void*`. While this is valid C code, I prefer an explicit cast if you intend to use the return value. If not, return NULL. --- _[auto_tests/tox_loop_test.c, line 76 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131#-KRUFrc0wzqVcG6rDZFm:-KRUFrc0wzqVcG6rDZFn:b-7dn43t) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/8a8b06ae01798793c7afdd7d59b8d2bd1ade45aa/auto_tests/tox_loop_test.c#L76)):_ > ``` C > tox_callback_loop_start(userdata_tcp.tox, tox_loop_cb_start); > tox_callback_loop_stop(userdata_tcp.tox, tox_loop_cb_stop); > pthread_create(&worker2, NULL, tox_loop_worker, &userdata_tcp); > ``` These threads are never joined. We don't know whether they actually return or keep running forever (until process termination). --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131)_

This error would then need to be handled in the caller. If you don't want the defence in depth, you can get rid of `max_sockets`. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131)_

_[toxcore/tox.c, line 557 at r5](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131#-KRb1y9fXpiKSJumAnuI:-KRb1y9fXpiKSJumAnuJ:b-hh051u) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/bd39b88be776f05d8535a0c365c1eb04e809f25b/toxcore/tox.c#L557)):_

> ``` C
> 
>         if (fdcount > list_size) {
>             fdlist = realloc(fdlist, fdcount * sizeof(uint32_t));
> ```

This realloc() call needs error handling, and fdlist needs to be free'd before the function exits.

---

_[toxcore/tox.c, line 567 at r5](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131#-KRb3o5cKn7wA4YK15uO:-KRb3o5d_CvnMfIu2CjO:bn6hdx2) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/bd39b88be776f05d8535a0c365c1eb04e809f25b/toxcore/tox.c#L567)):_

> ``` C
> 
>             if (fdlist[i] > maxfd) {
>                 maxfd = fdlist[i];
> ```

Assigning a uint32_t to an int is a bad idea. Same goes for the implicit cast with FD_SET(). Probably not a pragmatic concern here but it's bad form. Why isn't fdlist an int array?

---

_Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/131)_
